Its to friendship that we present our virtues, we become patient, tolerant, encouraging, and most of all, kind. We expect a little less and are hundreds of times more forgiving. We don't expect to be fully understood and therefore act more humanely towards our friends. We are in the presence of our friends our best selves, our own role models.

Throughout the history, the thought of romance had been ruined by many forms of entertainment we indulge in. That loving and being loved by someone is life's most important purpose. Though it may seem the case that friendship is but the consolation prize to a missed shot, many seem to miss the bigger picture. It is through our loved ones that we expect most to understand our deepest frustrations, and saddest moments. If one were to measure love in all those emotional fits and tantrums, one may mistake it for a psychological illness. To those we love, we open up and show our worst moods, unfair acusations, and wounding insults. Its to our lovers that we direct blame for the many things gone wrong with our lives. Its to them that we expect to know everything we mean without bothering to explain to them. Its to them that with minor errors and misunderstanding that we respond with sulks and rage.

Just some Philosophy/Psychology. A virtue is the most ideal thing people should look for, to be in either side of the spectrum is not ideal, in this case, the two spectrums would be lovers and enemies the virtuous path is friendship since it is between lover and enemy. To be friends, one will not need to expect a lot from you, yet they will still be there in times of need. Emotional baggages won't be heavy. To be placed in a category of not a lover but as a friend may seem hurtful and damming; it may also seem like you are alone and it is indeed a lonely feeling. But know that with a friend you may be alone but you won't be lonely.
